# Platform Overview: From Agent Chaos to Workflow Clarity

Kubiya is a revolutionary platform that bridges the gap between AI capabilities and production reliability. Unlike agent frameworks that let AI run wild, Kubiya puts you **on rails to production** with deterministic, containerized workflows.

## The Rails Approach to AI Automation

```mermaid
graph TD
    subgraph "Traditional Agent Frameworks"
        CHAOS[üå™Ô∏è Agent Chaos]
        A1[Unpredictable Paths]
        A2[State Management Hell]
        A3[Debug Nightmares]
        A4[Production Failures]
        
        CHAOS --> A1
        CHAOS --> A2
        CHAOS --> A3
        A1 --> A4
        A2 --> A4
        A3 --> A4
    end
    
    subgraph "Kubiya: On Rails"
        RAILS[üöÑ On Rails to Production]
        K1[Natural Language Input]
        K2[Deterministic Workflows]
        K3[Container Isolation]
        K4[Production Success]
        
        RAILS --> K1
        K1 --> K2
        K2 --> K3
        K3 --> K4
    end
    
    style CHAOS fill:#FF5252,stroke:#333,stroke-width:3px,color:#fff
    style A4 fill:#D32F2F,stroke:#333,stroke-width:2px,color:#fff
    
    style RAILS fill:#4CAF50,stroke:#333,stroke-width:3px,color:#fff
    style K4 fill:#2E7D32,stroke:#333,stroke-width:2px,color:#fff
```

## Why "On Rails"?

Just like Ruby on Rails revolutionized web development by providing conventions and structure, Kubiya revolutionizes AI automation by providing:

- **Convention over Configuration**: Sensible defaults for production workflows
- **Guardrails for Safety**: AI generates workflows within safe boundaries
- **Predictable Patterns**: Same input ‚Üí Same workflow ‚Üí Same result
- **Clear Path to Production**: From idea to deployed automation in minutes

## Core Architecture

```mermaid
graph TB
    subgraph "Input Layer"
        NL[Natural Language Request]
        API[API Call]
        MCP[MCP Client]
    end
    
    subgraph "AI Generation Layer"
        ADK[ADK Orchestrator]
        WG[Workflow Generator]
        VAL[Validation Engine]
    end
    
    subgraph "Execution Layer"
        subgraph "Deterministic DAG"
            S1[Step 1: Container A]
            S2[Step 2: Container B]
            S3[Step 3: Container C]
        end
    end
    
    subgraph "Infrastructure Layer"
        K8S[Kubernetes Runners]
        DOCKER[Docker Containers]
        STORAGE[Artifact Storage]
    end
    
    NL --> ADK
    API --> ADK
    MCP --> ADK
    
    ADK --> WG
    WG --> VAL
    VAL --> S1
    
    S1 --> S2
    S2 --> S3
    
    S1 -.->|runs in| DOCKER
    S2 -.->|runs in| DOCKER
    S3 -.->|runs in| DOCKER
    
    DOCKER -.->|orchestrated by| K8S
    S1 --> STORAGE
    S2 --> STORAGE
    S3 --> STORAGE
    
    style ADK fill:#9C27B0,stroke:#333,stroke-width:3px,color:#fff
    style S1 fill:#4CAF50,stroke:#333,stroke-width:2px
    style S2 fill:#4CAF50,stroke:#333,stroke-width:2px
    style S3 fill:#4CAF50,stroke:#333,stroke-width:2px
```

## Key Components

### 1. **ADK (Agent Development Kit)**
The intelligent orchestration layer that understands natural language and generates deterministic workflows.

<Card title="ü§ñ AI-Powered Generation" icon="robot">
  ADK translates your intent into structured workflows, not unpredictable agent chains
</Card>

### 2. **Workflow Engine**
Executes workflows as directed acyclic graphs (DAGs) with each step running in isolated containers.

<Card title="üöÑ Deterministic Execution" icon="train">
  Every execution follows the same path - no surprises, no agent wandering
</Card>

### 3. **Container Runtime**
Every workflow step runs in its own Docker container with complete isolation.

<Card title="üê≥ Universal Compatibility" icon="docker">
  Run any language, tool, or software - from Python to Go to Terraform
</Card>

### 4. **Runners**
Deploy runners on your infrastructure (Kubernetes, Docker, local) to execute workflows where your data lives.

<Card title="üèÉ Run Anywhere" icon="running">
  Your infrastructure, your control, your security boundaries
</Card>

## From Chaos to Clarity

### The Agent Framework Problem

```mermaid
graph LR
    subgraph "Agent Frameworks Journey"
        START[Start Task]
        
        A1[Agent Thinks]
        A2[Agent Acts]
        A3[Something Breaks]
        A4[Agent Retries]
        A5[Different Path]
        A6[Lost Context]
        A7[Manual Intervention]
        
        START --> A1
        A1 --> A2
        A2 --> A3
        A3 --> A4
        A4 --> A5
        A5 --> A6
        A6 --> A7
        
        A2 -.->|"Maybe?"| SUCCESS[Success?]
        A5 -.->|"Unlikely"| SUCCESS
        A7 --> FAILURE[üò≠ Production Down]
    end
    
    style A3 fill:#FF5252,stroke:#333,stroke-width:2px
    style A6 fill:#FF5252,stroke:#333,stroke-width:2px
    style FAILURE fill:#D32F2F,stroke:#333,stroke-width:3px,color:#fff
```

### The Kubiya Solution

```mermaid
graph LR
    subgraph "Kubiya Rails Journey"
        START[Define Goal]
        
        K1[ADK Generates Workflow]
        K2[Review & Validate]
        K3[Execute Step 1]
        K4[Execute Step 2]
        K5[Execute Step N]
        K6[Complete]
        
        START --> K1
        K1 --> K2
        K2 --> K3
        K3 --> K4
        K4 --> K5
        K5 --> K6
        
        K6 --> SUCCESS[‚úÖ Predictable Success]
    end
    
    style K1 fill:#9C27B0,stroke:#333,stroke-width:2px,color:#fff

```

## Platform Capabilities

### Natural Language to Workflow

Transform requirements into production-ready workflows:

```python
# Simple request
workflow = KubiyaWorkflow.from_prompt(
    "Deploy my Node.js app to Kubernetes with health checks",
    runner="kubiya-hosted"
)

# ADK generates complete workflow with:
# - Build steps
# - Test execution
# - Kubernetes deployment
# - Health monitoring
```

## The Rails Philosophy

<Note>
  **"Convention over Configuration"**: Kubiya provides sensible defaults and patterns that guide you toward production success, just like Rails did for web development.
</Note>

### Rails Principles Applied to AI Automation

1. **DRY (Don't Repeat Yourself)**
   - Reusable workflow templates
   - Shared tool definitions
   - Component libraries

2. **Convention over Configuration**
   - Standard workflow patterns
   - Default retry strategies
   - Built-in error handling

3. **Explicit is Better than Implicit**
   - Clear workflow definitions
   - Visible execution paths
   - Transparent logging

4. **Fast Development, Reliable Deployment**
   - Quick prototyping with AI
   - Production-ready from day one
   - No rewrite needed

## Getting Started

<Steps>
  <Step title="Install SDK">
    ```bash
    pip install kubiya-workflow-sdk
    ```
  </Step>
  
  <Step title="Generate First Workflow">
    ```python
    from kubiya_workflow_sdk import KubiyaWorkflow
    
    workflow = KubiyaWorkflow.from_prompt(
        "Create a backup of my PostgreSQL database",
        runner="kubiya-hosted"
    )
    ```
  </Step>
  
  <Step title="Review and Execute">
    ```python
    # See what will run
    print(workflow.to_yaml())
    
    # Execute with confidence
    result = workflow.execute()
    ```
  </Step>
</Steps>
